intro: Moraea plumaria, commonly known as the plumaria lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea plumaria is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
